intro: Vaccinium cavinerve, commonly known as the narrow-veined blueberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like heather and cranberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically blue or purple in color, similar to other Vaccinium species. Its leaves are leathery and have a distinctive, narrow venation pattern that gives it its scientific name. This plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in cool, moist environments.
